intro: Scutia spicata var. spicata, commonly known as the spiny scutia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and spiny leaves, which provide a natural defense against herbivores. Its small, white flowers are clustered in spikes, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
